aliases.name: Kelly-Hopkinsville Encounter
aliases.meaning: Named for both Kelly and Hopkinsville, Kentucky

description.summary: August 21, 1955 alleged alien encounter near Kelly and Hopkinsville, Kentucky. Seven witnesses reported small, silvery humanoid creatures approaching a farmhouse over several hours. Police found no evidence but witnesses were genuinely terrified. Explanations range from great horned owls to genuine unknown encounter.
description.full: The Hopkinsville Goblins incident occurred on the night of August 21-22, 1955, at the Sutton farmhouse between Kelly and Hopkinsville, Kentucky. Members of the Sutton and Taylor families (7+ witnesses) reported that small, 3-4 foot tall beings with large eyes, long arms, and silvery/metallic appearance approached the house after a landed craft was observed. The families shot at the creatures multiple times with firearms, but the beings seemed unaffected and continued approaching windows and the roof. The encounter lasted several hours. Police investigation found no physical evidence but witnesses were clearly terrified. The incident remains unexplained, with proposed explanations including great horned owls, mass hysteria, or genuine unknown encounter. Witnesses maintained their story for life.

location.description: Sutton farmhouse between Kelly and Hopkinsville, Kentucky
location.locality: Christian County, between Kelly and Hopkinsville

sequence_of_events.event: Billy Ray Taylor observes bright object
sequence_of_events.description: Taylor saw bright object land in gully behind farmhouse, reported to others
Small silvery creature approaches house, Taylor and Sutton shoot at it with rifles
Creatures repeatedly approach house, appear at windows, climb on roof. Family shoots at them multiple times. Creatures seem unaffected, 'float' when shot.
All family members drive to Hopkinsville police station, clearly terrified
Police investigate farmhouse, find bullet holes and evidence of gunfire, but no creatures or physical evidence of beings
After police leave, witnesses report creatures returned briefly

appearance.description: Silvery, metallic appearance, seemed to glow faintly
Very large, yellow or amber colored
Large head relative to body, somewhat pointed at top
Large, pointed ears, bat-like or elephant-like
Disproportionately long, extending below knees, thin
Thin, seemed to move in unusual manner

physical_characteristics.coloration: Silver/metallic, some descriptions mention greenish tinge

movement: Raised arms above head when frightened or shot
actions: No apparent hostility despite being shot at
Made no attempt to enter house
behavior.demeanor: Curious but non-aggressive, persistent despite gunfire

anomalous_characteristics: Seemed immune to gunfire (bullets passed through or had no effect)
Floated or moved in unusual manner when hit

physical.description: Police found bullet holes in house and evidence of extensive gunfire
physical.significance: Proves guns were fired, confirms witness accounts of shooting

physical.description: Police confirmed witnesses were genuinely terrified, not intoxicated
physical.significance: Rules out hoax or alcohol-induced delusion

lack_of_evidence.description: Police found no creatures, bodies, or remains
No unusual tracks or footprints found
No UFO or craft found in gully

witness_testimony.consistency: High - all witnesses told similar story
witness_testimony.persistence: Witnesses maintained story for rest of lives
witness_testimony.credibility: No apparent motive for hoax, genuine fear documented

findings: Bullet holes and spent shells confirmed gunfire
No unusual tracks or physical evidence
No evidence of intoxication or drugs
police_response.conclusion: Officers found no physical evidence of creatures but believed witnesses experienced something that terrified them

civilian_investigators.findings: Case remains unexplained, multiple theories proposed

extraterrestrial.name: Genuine alien encounter
extraterrestrial.description: Beings were extraterrestrial visitors from landed craft

natural_explanation.name: Great horned owls
natural_explanation.description: Witnesses misidentified aggressive great horned owls defending territory
evidence_cited: Great horned owls have large eyes, can seem silvery in moonlight
Owls are aggressive when defending nests
Owls are largely immune to small caliber gunfire when shot at distance
Height matches owls in flight or on fence
criticisms: Witnesses were experienced hunters, should recognize owls
Description includes features not owl-like (silvery skin, long arms)
Duration of encounter seems long for owl confrontation

psychological.name: Mass hysteria
psychological.description: Initial misidentification escalated into shared delusion
criticisms: Too many specific details for pure hysteria

hoax.name: Deliberate fabrication
hoax.description: Family invented story as hoax or prank
criticisms: No apparent motive - family shunned publicity
Witnesses maintained story for life without profiting
Children included - difficult to maintain hoax
No witness ever recanted or admitted hoax

unknown.name: Unexplained encounter
unknown.description: Something unusual occurred, but nature remains unknown

immediate.media_coverage: Extensive newspaper and radio coverage in 1955
immediate.public_reaction: Curiosity seekers visited farmhouse (family eventually moved)
immediate.local_impact: Kelly, Kentucky became associated with incident

long_term.ufo_history: One of most famous early alien encounter cases
long_term.influence: Early description of large-eyed humanoids, predates common 'grey alien' archetype
long_term.annual_event: Kelly Little Green Men Days festival held annually
long_term.tourism: Incident brings visitors to Kelly, Kentucky

references: Featured in numerous UFO books and documentaries
Influenced alien creature designs in fiction
Subject of paranormal investigations and TV shows

witness_accounts.consistency: Remarkably consistent across multiple witnesses and over decades
witness_accounts.public_statements: Most witnesses avoided publicity, some gave occasional interviews
witness_accounts.deathbed_accounts: Witnesses who gave later interviews maintained story was true

current_status.evidence_level: Medium - credible witnesses, consistent testimony, no physical evidence
current_status.researcher_consensus: Divided - some favor owl explanation, others consider it unexplained
current_status.public_interest: Remains popular in UFO literature and local Kentucky culture
